result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence currenlty being served but CONSECUTIVE to Ct.5

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute Sobriety to include the prohibition of purchasing, possession, sale, or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.

No contact with victims (E.B., M.K., and K.S.) in the case through social media, third party or their residence, property or place of employment.

The defendant will be supervised based on the Department of Corrections evaluation.

Payment of court costs, restitution, and DOC supervision fees.

Enter into, participate in, and successfully complete any assessment, evaluations, and treatment programs such as AODA and, Cognitive Intervention programming and any others as deemed appropriate by either the agent or Department of Corrections.

Case Called: 1:41 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence and ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Rex Anderegg.
Both parties have received the PSI Reports and Memorandums. 
Parties make statements re: PSI Report and corrections to be made.
State makes sentencing arguments. 
Defense makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant's Mother makes statement. 
D.P. sworn and testifies. 
Defendant makes statement. 
OTR- 3:02 PM
BOTR- 3:08 PM
Court addresses the Defendant. 
COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 3 (1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-PTAC)>> 9 Years WSPS, 4 IC and 5 Years ES, Consecutive to Ct. 5 and Concurrent to any sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: The defendant will be supervised based on the Department of Corrections evaluation, Payment of court costs, restitution and DOC supervision fees, Absolute sobriety to include the prohibition of purchasing, possession, sale or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders. No contact with the victims  (E.B., M.K. and K.S) in the case through social media, third party or their residence, property or place of employment. Enter into, participate in, and successfully complete any assessment, evaluations, and treatment programs such as AODA and, Cognitive Intervention programming and any others as deemed appropriate by either the agent or Department of Corrections. Court finds 191 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP Programming. 

Ct. 5 (Felon Possess Firearm)>> 6 Years WSPS, 3 IC and 3 Years ES, Consecutive to Ct. 3 and Concurrent to any sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: The defendant will be supervised based on the Department of Corrections evaluation, Payment of court costs, restitution and DOC supervision fees, Absolute sobriety to include the prohibition of purchasing, possession, sale or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders. No contact with the victims  (E.B., M.K. and K.S) in the case through social media, third party or their residence, property or place of employment. Enter into, participate in, and successfully complete any assessment, evaluations, and treatment programs such as AODA and, Cognitive Intervention programming and any others as deemed appropriate by either the agent or Department of Corrections. Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP Programming. 

PSI REPORTS TO BE SEALED AND KEPT BY THE PARTIES. 
REMANDED TO WSPS.

Return of Officer

Absolute sobriety from alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. No contact with victim(s): E.B., M.K., K.S., M.S. Jr., and Our Club House. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
